posts.post_content:
This is better mid-late game, while Duress is better earlygame.  
  
However, duress can never get creatures, so it depends on what you're up against.  
  
Of course thoughtseize beats them both

posts.post_content: I'd say [Duress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Duress) is better. This only becomes effective when you have 4 or 5 Swamps and can see their whole hand and by that time it probably won't really be all that effective. Duress lets you see the whole hand for one even though you can't discard anything you want. Still a decent card but not anything overly powerful.

Posted By: Sironos (5/5/2010 11:44:50 AM)

posts.post_content: This isn't bad. Best at 1-3 copies as you don't really want to use it before you get 3+ swamps in play. Depending on your opponents deck this could become active as early as turn 3. Pretty decent against control as well as playing this late game will let you discard their most important/threatening card. The real downside to this is you can only play it in mono-black and even then you need to limit yourself to mostly swamps.

Posted By: blurrymadness (3/26/2013 9:55:05 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
People don't seem to realize that this costs ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol). [Mind Sludge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Sludge) is ![4](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=4&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol). [Mind Shatter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Shatter) is ![Variable Colorless](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=X&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol). Both of those require a lot of mana.  
  
What this is is a very low cost card that gets progressively better as the game goes on. Turn one, it's just "Target opponent discards a card." Turn four, it's usually "Target player reveals their hand and discards a card of your choice." All while leaving the rest of your mana open for your other spells or abilities.  
  
This card is fantastic for a one mana discard spell. Not quite as good as [Duress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Duress), I think, but still quite good, and has the potential to really screw up your opponent's hand.
posts.html:
People don't seem to realize that this costs . Mind Sludge is . Mind Shatter is . Both of those require a lot of mana.

What this is is a very low cost card that gets progressively better as the game goes on. Turn one, it's just "Target opponent discards a card." Turn four, it's usually "Target player reveals their hand and discards a card of your choice." All while leaving the rest of your mana open for your other spells or abilities.

This card is fantastic for a one mana discard spell. Not quite as good as Duress, I think, but still quite good, and has the potential to really screw up your opponent's hand.
